00046 #ifndef FTP_SUCCESS
00047 #define FTP_SUCCESS                   1
00048 #define FTP_NET_ERROR               802
00049 #define FTP_FILE_ERROR              803
00050 #define FTP_RESPONSE_ERROR          804
00051 #define FTP_INVALID_ARG             805
00052 #endif

00054 static char bars[] = "/-\\|";
00055 int (*ftp_debug_func) (char *message);
00056 int (*ftp_error_func) (char *message);

00060 void ftp_debug(int (*debug_func) (char *message), int (*error_func) (char *message))
00061 /* set message display functions for debug and error messages */
00062 {
00063    ftp_debug_func = debug_func;
00064    ftp_error_func = error_func;
00065 }

00068 
00069 int ftp_connect(FTP_CON ** con, char *host_name, unsigned short port)
00070 /* Connect to a FTP server on a host at a given port (usually 21).
00071    Return a FTP_CON structure if successful */
00072 {
00073    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
00074    int sock;
00075    char str[4000];
00076    int status;
00077    struct hostent *phe;
00078 
00079    *con = NULL;
00080 
00081 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00082    {
00083       WSADATA WSAData;
00084 
00085       /* Start windows sockets */
00086       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
00087          return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00088    }
00089 #endif
00090 
00091    if ((sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) == -1) {
00092       if (ftp_error_func)
00093          ftp_error_func("cannot create socket");
00094       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00095    }
00096 
00097    /* connect to remote node */
00098    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
00099    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00100    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
00101    bind_addr.sin_port = htons(port);
00102 
00103 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00104    {
00105       INT host_addr;
00106 
00107       host_addr = hostGetByName(host_name);
00108       memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), &host_addr, 4);
00109    }
00110 #else
00111    phe = gethostbyname(host_name);
00112    if (phe == NULL) {
00113       if (ftp_error_func)
00114          ftp_error_func("cannot get host name");
00115       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
00116    }
00117    memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), phe->h_addr, phe->h_length);
00118 #endif
00119 
00120 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00121    do {
00122       status = connect(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
00123 
00124       /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
00125    } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00126 #else
00127    status = connect(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
00128 #endif
00129 
00130    if (status != 0) {
00131       sprintf(str, "cannot connect to host %s, port %d", host_name, port);
00132       if (ftp_error_func)
00133          ftp_error_func(str);
00134       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00135    }
00136 
00137 
00138    *con = (FTP_CON *) malloc(sizeof(FTP_CON));
00139    (*con)->sock = sock;
00140    (*con)->data = 0;
00141 
00142    memset(str, 0, sizeof(str));
00143    status = ftp_get_message(*con, str);
00144 
00145    /* check for status */
00146    if (status == QUIT || !ftp_good(status, 120, 220, EOF)) {
00147       closesocket(sock);
00148       free(*con);
00149       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00150    }
00151 
00152    return FTP_SUCCESS;
00153 }
00154 
00155 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00156 
00157 int ftp_send_message(FTP_CON * con, char *message)
00158 /* send a message to a FTP server */
00159 {
00160    if (send(con->sock, message, strlen(message), 0) == -1)
00161       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00162 
00163    if (send(con->sock, "\r\n", 2, 0) == -1)
00164       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00165 
00166    if (ftp_debug_func != NULL)
00167       ftp_debug_func(message);
00168 
00169    return FTP_SUCCESS;
00170 }
00171 
00172 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00173 
00174 int ftp_command(FTP_CON * con, char *command, char *param, ...)
00175 /* execute FTP command, check for return codes */
00176 {
00177    va_list args;
00178    char str[2048];
00179    int status, code;
00180    BOOL result_ok;
00181 
00182    /* compose command string */
00183    sprintf(str, command, param);
00184 
00185    /* send command */
00186    if (ftp_send_message(con, str) != FTP_SUCCESS)
00187       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00188 
00189    /* read reply */
00190    status = ftp_get_message(con, str);
00191    if (status == QUIT)
00192       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00193 
00194    /* check reply code */
00195    va_start(args, param);
00196 
00197    result_ok = FALSE;
00198    do {
00199       code = va_arg(args, int);
00200       if (code == EOF)
00201          break;
00202 
00203       if (code == status)
00204          result_ok = TRUE;
00205 
00206    } while (!result_ok);
00207 
00208    va_end(args);
00209 
00210    if (!result_ok) {
00211       if (ftp_error_func != NULL)
00212          ftp_error_func(str);
00213 
00214       return FTP_RESPONSE_ERROR;
00215    }
00216 
00217    return -status;
00218 }
00219 
00220 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00221 
00222 int ftp_get_message(FTP_CON * con, char *message)
00223 /* read message from FTP server */
00224 {
00225    int i, err_no;
00226 
00227    for (i = 0;; i++) {
00228       if (recv(con->sock, &message[i], 1, 0) != 1)
00229          return QUIT;
00230 
00231       if (i > 1 && message[i] == 10 && message[i - 1] == 13)
00232          break;
00233    }
00234 
00235    message[i - 1] = 0;
00236 
00237    err_no = atoi(message);
00238    if(err_no != 0) {
00239      con->err_no = err_no;
00240   }
00241 
00242    if (ftp_debug_func != NULL)
00243       ftp_debug_func(message);
00244 
00245    /* check for continuation message */
00246    if (message[3] == '-' || err_no == 0)
00247       ftp_get_message(con, message + strlen(message));
00248 
00249    return con->err_no;
00250 }

00252 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00253 
00254 BOOL ftp_good(int number, ...)
00255 /* check if number matches any code from argument list */
00256 {
00257    va_list args;
00258    BOOL result;
00259    int code;
00260 
00261    va_start(args, number);
00262    result = FALSE;
00263 
00264    do {
00265       code = va_arg(args, int);
00266       if (code == EOF)
00267          break;
00268 
00269       if (code == number)
00270          result = TRUE;
00271 
00272    } while (!result);
00273 
00274    va_end(args);
00275 
00276    return result;
00277 }

00280 
00281 int ftp_data(FTP_CON * con, char *command, char *file)
00282 /* open data socket */
00283 {
00284    struct sockaddr_in data, from;
00285    struct hostent *host;
00286    char host_name[256];
00287    int listen_socket, data_socket;
00288    int len = sizeof(data), one = 1, fromlen = sizeof(from), status;
00289    char *a, *b;
00290 
00291    memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
00292    memset(&from, 0, sizeof(from));
00293 
00294    if (gethostname(host_name, sizeof(host_name)) == -1)
00295       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00296 
00297    if ((host = (struct hostent *) gethostbyname(host_name)) == 0)
00298       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00299 
00300    if ((listen_socket = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) == -1)
00301       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00302 
00303    if (setsockopt(listen_socket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR,
00304                   (char *) &one, sizeof(one)) < 0) {
00305       closesocket(listen_socket);
00306       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00307    }
00308 
00309    data.sin_family = AF_INET;
00310    data.sin_port = htons(0);
00311    data.sin_addr.s_addr = *(unsigned long *) *(host->h_addr_list);
00312 
00313    if (bind(listen_socket, (struct sockaddr *) &data, sizeof(data)) == -1) {
00314       closesocket(listen_socket);
00315       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00316    }
00317 
00318    if (getsockname(listen_socket, (struct sockaddr *) &data, &len) < 0) {
00319       closesocket(listen_socket);
00320       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00321    }
00322 
00323    if (listen(listen_socket, 1) != 0) {
00324       closesocket(listen_socket);
00325       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00326    }
00327 
00328    a = (char *) &data.sin_addr;
00329    b = (char *) &data.sin_port;
00330 
00331    status = ftp_port(con, CUT(a[0]), CUT(a[1]), CUT(a[2]),
00332                      CUT(a[3]), CUT(b[0]), CUT(b[1]));
00333    if (status != FTP_SUCCESS)
00334       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00335 
00336    status = ftp_command(con, command, file, 200, 120, 150, 125, 250, EOF);
00337    if (status >= 0)
00338       return status;
00339 
00340    data_socket = accept(listen_socket, (struct sockaddr *) &from, &fromlen);
00341 
00342    if (data_socket == -1) {
00343       closesocket(listen_socket);
00344       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00345    }
00346 
00347    closesocket(listen_socket);
00348 
00349    con->data = data_socket;
00350 
00351    return status;
00352 }
00353 
00354 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00355 
00356 int ftp_close(FTP_CON * con)
00357 /* close data connection */
00358 {
00359    char str[256];
00360 
00361    closesocket(con->data);
00362 
00363    return ftp_get_message(con, str);
00364 }
00365 
00366 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00367 
00368 int ftp_send(int sock, char *buffer, int n_bytes_to_write)
00369 /* send number of bytes over socket */
00370 {
00371    int n_bytes_left, n_written;
00372 
00373    n_bytes_left = n_bytes_to_write;
00374 
00375    while (n_bytes_left > 0) {
00376       n_written = send(sock, buffer, n_bytes_left > 8192 ? 8192 : n_bytes_left, 0);
00377       if (n_written <= 0)
00378          return n_bytes_to_write - n_bytes_left;
00379 
00380       n_bytes_left -= n_written;
00381       buffer += n_written;
00382    }
00383 
00384    return n_bytes_to_write;
00385 }
00386 
00387 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00388 
00389 int ftp_receive(int sock, char *buffer, int bsize)
00390 /* receive buffer from socket, return number of received bytes */
00391 {
00392    int count, i;
00393 
00394    i = 0;
00395    while (TRUE) {
00396       count = recv(sock, buffer + i, bsize - 1 - i, 0);
00397       if (count <= 0)
00398          return i;
00399 
00400       i += count;
00401       buffer[i] = 0;
00402 
00403       if (i >= bsize - 1)
00404          return i;
00405    }
00406 }
00407 
00408 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00409 
00410 int ftp_login(FTP_CON ** con, char *host, unsigned short port,
00411               char *user, char *password, char *account)
00412 /* FTP login with username and password */
00413 {
00414    int status;
00415 
00416    status = ftp_connect(con, host, port);
00417    if (status != FTP_SUCCESS)
00418       return status;
00419 
00420    status = ftp_user(*con, user);
00421    if (status >= 0)
00422       return status;
00423 
00424    if (status == -230)
00425       return status;
00426 
00427    if (status == -332) {
00428       if (account == NULL)
00429          return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00430 
00431       status = ftp_account(*con, account);
00432       if (status < 1)
00433          return status;
00434 
00435       if (status == -230)
00436          return status;
00437    }
00438 
00439    return ftp_password(*con, password);
00440 }

00443 
00444 int ftp_bye(FTP_CON * con)
00445 /* disconnect from FTP server */
00446 {
00447    char str[256];
00448 
00449    ftp_send_message(con, "QUIT");
00450    ftp_get_message(con, str);
00451 
00452    closesocket(con->sock);
00453    free(con);
00454 
00455    return FTP_SUCCESS;
00456 }

00459 
00460 int ftp_port(FTP_CON * con, int a, int b, int c, int d, int e, int f)
00461 /* set port for data connection */
00462 {
00463    char cmd[256];
00464    int status;
00465 
00466    sprintf(cmd, "PORT %d,%d,%d,%d,%d,%d", a, b, c, d, e, f);
00467    if (ftp_send_message(con, cmd) != FTP_SUCCESS)
00468       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00469 
00470    status = ftp_get_message(con, cmd);
00471    if (status == QUIT)
00472       return QUIT;
00473 
00474    if (!ftp_good(status, 200, EOF))
00475       return FTP_NET_ERROR;
00476 
00477    return FTP_SUCCESS;
00478 }

00481 
00482 int ftp_move(FTP_CON * con, char *oldname, char *newname)
00483 /* move/rename file */
00484 {
00485    int status;
00486 
00487    status = ftp_command(con, "RNFR %s", oldname, 200, 350, EOF);
00488 
00489    if (status < 0)
00490       return ftp_command(con, "RNTO %s", newname, 200, 250, EOF);
00491    else
00492       return status;
00493 }
00494 
00495 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00496 
00497 int ftp_get(FTP_CON * con, char *local_name, char *remote_name)
00498 /* get file */
00499 {
00500    int fh;
00501    int status;
00502    char buff[8192];
00503    char str[256];
00504    int count, i;
00505    long total = 0;
00506    DWORD start, stop;
00507 
00508    if (ftp_open_read(con, remote_name) >= 0)
00509       return con->err_no;
00510 
00511    if ((fh = open(local_name, O_RDWR | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_BINARY, 0644)) == -1)
00512       return FTP_FILE_ERROR;
00513 
00514    start = ss_millitime();
00515 
00516    while ((count = ftp_receive(con->data, buff, sizeof(buff))) > 0) {
00517       total += write(fh, buff, count);
00518       i = 0;
00519       if (ftp_debug_func != NULL) {
00520          printf("%c\r", bars[(i++) % 4]);
00521          fflush(stdout);
00522       }
00523    }
00524 
00525    close(fh);
00526    stop = ss_millitime();
00527 
00528    status = ftp_close(con);
00529    if (ftp_debug_func != NULL) {
00530       sprintf(str, "%ld bytes received in %1.2f seconds (%1.2lf kB/sec).",
00531               total, (stop - start) / 1000.0, total / 1024.0 / ((stop - start) / 1000.0));
00532       ftp_debug_func(str);
00533    }
00534 
00535    return status;
00536 }
00537 
00538 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00539 
00540 int ftp_put(FTP_CON * con, char *local_name, char *remote_name)
00541 /* put file */
00542 {
00543    int fh;
00544    int status;
00545    char buff[8193];
00546    char str[256];
00547    int count, i = 0;
00548    long total = 0;
00549    DWORD start, stop;
00550 
00551    if (ftp_open_write(con, remote_name) >= 0)
00552       return con->err_no;
00553 
00554    if ((fh = open(local_name, O_BINARY)) == -1)
00555       return FTP_FILE_ERROR;
00556 
00557    start = ss_millitime();
00558 
00559    while ((count = read(fh, buff, 8192)) > 0) {
00560       total += ftp_send(con->data, buff, count);
00561       if (ftp_debug_func != NULL) {
00562          printf("%c\r", bars[(i++) % 4]);
00563          fflush(stdout);
00564       }
00565    }
00566 
00567    close(fh);
00568    stop = ss_millitime();
00569 
00570    status = ftp_close(con);
00571    if (ftp_debug_func != NULL) {
00572       sprintf(str, "%ld bytes sent in %1.2f seconds (%1.2lf kB/sec).",
00573               total, (stop - start) / 1000.0, total / 1024.0 / ((stop - start) / 1000.0));
00574       ftp_debug_func(str);
00575    }
00576 
00577    return status;
00578 }
00579 
00580 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00581 
00582 char *ftp_pwd(FTP_CON * con)
00583 /* show present working directory */
00584 {
00585    static char str[256];
00586    char tmp[256];
00587    int status;
00588 
00589    str[0] = 0;
00590    if (ftp_send_message(con, "PWD") != FTP_SUCCESS)
00591       return str;
00592 
00593    status = ftp_get_message(con, tmp);
00594 
00595    if (status != 257) {
00596       if (ftp_error_func != NULL)
00597          ftp_error_func(tmp);
00598 
00599       return str;
00600    }
00601 
00602    sscanf(tmp, "%*[^\"]%*c%[^\"]%*s", str);
00603 
00604    return str;
00605 }
00606 
00607 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00608 
00609 int ftp_dir(FTP_CON * con, char *file)
00610 /* display directory */
00611 {
00612    char command[256], buffer[8192];
00613 
00614    if (file == NULL || *file == '\0')
00615       strcpy(command, "LIST");
00616    else
00617       sprintf(command, "LIST %s", file);
00618 
00619    if (ftp_data(con, command, "") >= 0)
00620       return con->err_no;
00621 
00622    while (ftp_receive(con->data, buffer, sizeof(buffer)))
00623       printf(buffer);
00624 
00625    return ftp_close(con);
00626 }
